revised_title: A Comprehensive Study of Culicidae Species in India and Their Role in Malaria Transmission
tldr: The author provides a detailed description of the Culicidae species found in India, focusing on Anopheles species and their role in malaria transmission. The study aims to facilitate research on malaria in British India by categorizing and describing known species and their characteristics. The author emphasizes the importance of studying various genera and species in connection with diseases like malaria, yellow fever, and filariasis.
